page.title: 18Environmental local issues
page.content: Like many areas there are continuing local issues that provide opportunities for debate and involvement. These may range from disappearing footpaths and public rights of way to new estate developments.There are old,flooded and disused chalk quarries left now as a landmark, fenced and abandoned, too dangerous for children to go near. Bus routes,once providing services through the area,have become mere skeletons by comparison.Youngsters seek leisure facilities beyond the local park and are frustrated by lack of opportunities.Farmers anxious to maximise their crop yield use aerial spraying and controlled stubble burning.The river defences are built up as part of the Thames protection scheme to safeguard farmland and homes.
